SENT.plain: A neurologically intact 37-year-old woman presented with an acute severe frontal headache after a month of intermittent headaches

Multimodal radiological examination including computed tomography scan, magnetic resonance imaging, and conventional angiography demonstrated a 1 cm mass in the anterior interhemispheric region with heterogenous calcifications
Of note, MR revealed restricted diffusion within the mass
The presumptive diagnosis of dermoid tumor was made and the patient was scheduled for surgical resection
On operative exploration, a 1 cm thrombosed aneurysm was revealed
Thrombosed aneurysms must be considered in the differential diagnosis for midline cerebral masses with negative angiogram and restricted diffusion
This distinction has implications for the clinical management of the patient
